DataElement.preferredName: Most Superior Computed Tomography Coordinate Diaphragm Performed Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the free-text field for the highest coordinate used during a method of examining body organs by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis in which dome of hemidiaphragm is visible.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Most Superior Computed Tomography Coordinate Diaphragm Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to highest coordinate used during a method of examining body organs by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis in which dome of hemidiaphragm is visible.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Greatest in amount, extent, or degree.:In anatomy indicating higher than a given reference point.:A method of examining body organs by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis. :A number or other designation that identifies a position relative to an axis or grid.

Concepts.definition: Greatest in amount, extent, or degree; constituting a majority.
In anatomy, indicating higher than a given reference point.
A method of examining structures within the body by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis.
A number or other designation that identifies a position relative to an axis or grid.

Property.preferredDefinition: (DYE-a-fram) The thin muscle below the lungs and heart that separates the chest from the abdomen.:Performed; carried out.

Concepts.definition: Fibromuscular tissue that separates the thoracic from the abdominal cavity. It increases the volume of the thoracic cavity through contractions, thus facilitating respiration.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
